definitions.definition: A deductible amount can be taken away from a total:
examples: Expenses like office phone bills are tax-deductible (= you do not have to pay tax on them).

definitions.definition: an amount of money that is taken away from an employee's pay before they receive it
a part of the cost of an accident, injury, etc. that you agree to pay yourself when you buy insurance:
examples: Customers can lower insurance premiums by taking higher deductibles.
